numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The Cold War ended in 1991.
2. After 1991, the number of global crises did not fall.
3. After 1991, the number of global crises increased.
4. After 1991, the number of regional crises did not fall.
5. After 1991, the number of regional crises increased.
6. In 1991, a new world order was established.
7. This new world order was endowed with hope.
8. Many adults are more than 40 years old.
9. Adults who are more than 40 years old experienced many crises.
10. Adults who are more than 40 years old hoped that things would gradually settle down.
11. The U.S.S.R. collapsed.
12. After the collapse of the U.S.S.R., things did not gradually settle down.
13. After the collapse of the U.S.S.R., the opposite happened.
14. Many adults who are more than 40 years old are disappointed.
15. The hope for a nonviolent world decreased.
16. A poll exists.
17. In the poll, adults who are more than 40 years old are generally more pessimistic about the current world than young adults.
18. Young adults are between 15 and 24 years old.
19. This situation is an answer to a question.
20. The question is why adults who are more than 40 years old are more pessimistic than young adults.
21. Young adults grew up with pervasive high-end technologies.
22. Young adults grew up with democracies.
23. Young adults do not know what adults who are more than 40 years old lived through in childhood and adolescence.
24. The childhood and adolescence of adults who are more than 40 years old was an era.
25. This era was dominated by political animosity between Western democracies and Eastern communist dictatorships.
26. This political animosity gave rise to many global conflicts.
27. In the poll, younger adults have generally more positive thoughts about the world than older adults.
